content.description:
Ipse deum manifestomanifestus, -a, -um, adj. = clarus, -a, -um in lumine vidi
intrantem muros vocemque his auribus hausi. 
Desinedesino, -ere: to stop meque tuis incendereincendo, -ere = consumo, -ere teque querelisquerela, -ae, f.: complaint; 
Italiam non spontesponte, adv.: willingly sequor.
content.question: In line 2, what does hausi mean?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
